metadata.title: CVE-2022-48654 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:netfilter: nfnetlink_osf: fix possible bogus match in nf_osf_find()nf_osf_find() incorrectly returns true on mismatch, this leads to copyinguninitialized memory area in nft_osf which can be used to leak stale kernelstack data to userspace.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48654` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-136.153~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-136.153~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
